00022 #ifndef __VECTORMAP_H_
00023 #define __VECTORMAP_H_
00024 
00025 //
00026 #include <algorithm>
00027 #include <cassert>
00028 #include <cstdio>
00029 #include <utility>
00030 #include <vector>
00031 
00032 /// @file   vectormap.h
00033 /// @brief  An STL container like "map" but with reduced space and
00034 ///         a requirement to sort before lookups.
00035 
00036 //! The standard STL "map" keeps its elements in a sorted
00037 //! tree.  The norm code only needs to sort the data before
00038 //! use and a vector uses less memory.  The disadvantage to
00039 //! vectormap is the elements are not kept in order.  Before
00040 //! any lookups are done the vector is sorted.  If the
00041 //! inserts and lookups are alternated, much time will be
00042 //! spent sorting.
00043 
00044 using namespace std;
00045 
00046 ////////////////////
00047 
00048 template <typename T1> class pair_key_asc {
00049 public:
00050   /// @brief        Compare pairs by the key
00051   /// @return       true if pair1.key < pair2.key
00052   /// @remark       The key is the first value of the pair.
00053   bool operator()(const T1& pair1, const T1& pair2) const {
00054     return pair1.first < pair2.first;
00055   }
00056 };
00057 
00058 template <typename T1,typename T2> class pair_cmp_key {
00059 public:
00060   /// @brief       compare a pair to a key value. 
00061   /// @return      Returns (-1,0,+1)
00062   int operator()(const T1& pair, const T2& key) const {
00063     if (pair.first < key) {
00064       return +1;
00065     }
00066     if (key < pair.first) {
00067       return -1;
00068     }
00069     if (pair.first==key) {
00070       return 0;
00071     }
00072     assert(0);
00073   }
00074 };
00075 
00076 template <typename T1> class pair_cmp_key_bool {
00077  public:
00078   /// @brief       A weak ordering.
00079   /// @return      true if pair1.key < pair2.key
00080   bool operator()(const T1 & pair, const T1 & key) const {
00081     if (pair.first < key.first) {
00082       return true;
00083     }
00084     return false;
00085   }
00086 };
00087       
00088 
00089 //! vectormap == A map with the KeyVal pairs stored in a vector.
00090 //! the vector is sorted when needed.
00091 
00092 template <typename Key,typename Val>
00093 class vectormap
00094 {
00095  public:
00096   //! the key type of the map
00097   typedef Key key_t;
00098   //! the value type of the map
00099   typedef Val val_t;
00100   typedef pair<key_t,val_t> keyval_t;
00101   typedef typename vector<keyval_t>::iterator iterator;
00102   typedef typename vector<keyval_t>::iterator iterator_t;
00103 
00104   //! All the pairs are stored here.
00105   vector<keyval_t> vec;
00106   int is_sorted;
00107 
00108   vectormap() {
00109     clear();
00110   };
00111 
00112   /// @brief start iterator of the vector
00113   iterator_t begin() { return vec.begin(); }
00114   /// @brief end iterator of the vector
00115   iterator_t end()   { return vec.end();   }
00116 
00117   /// @brief       Random access to the map contents.
00118   /// @param       n         the index
00119   /// @return      the keyval at that index
00120   /// @remark      Contents might not be sorted
00121   keyval_t& operator[](size_t n) {
00122     return vec[n];
00123   }
00124 
00125   /// @brief       Removes all the data
00126   void clear() { vec.clear(); is_sorted=1; };
00127   /// @return      the size of the map
00128   size_t size() { return vec.size(); }
00129 
00130   /// @brief       adds the (key,val) to the map
00131   /// @param       key       
00132   /// @param       val       
00133   /// @remark      The pair is created for you.
00134   void insert_kv(key_t key,val_t val) {
00135     is_sorted=0;
00136     vec.push_back(pair<key_t,val_t>(key,val));
00137   }
00138 
00139   /// @brief       adds a pair(key,val) to the map
00140   /// @param       keyval    a pair of (key,val)
00141   void insert(keyval_t keyval) {
00142     is_sorted=0;
00143     vec.push_back(keyval);
00144   };
00145   
00146   /// @brief       sort the map before use. Sets is_sorted to true.
00147   void sort_key_asc() {
00148     //printf("SORT!====(before)\n"); print();
00149     pair_key_asc<keyval_t> func;
00150     sort(vec.begin(),vec.end(),func);
00151     is_sorted=1;
00152     //printf("SORT!====(after)\n"); print();
00153   };
00154 
00155   // make sure the vectormap is sorted.
00156   // However! normalization does its own sorting.
00157   // so dont sort the vectors 
00158   void ensure_sorted() {
00159     if (is_sorted==1) {
00160        return;
00161     }
00162     sort_key_asc();
00163   };
00164 
00165   iterator_t vlower_bound(const key_t key) {
00166     pair_cmp_key_bool<keyval_t> cmpfunc;
00167     //ensure_sorted();
00168     return lower_bound(begin(),end(),keyval_t(key,val_t()),cmpfunc);
00169   }
00170   iterator_t vupper_bound(const key_t key) {
00171     pair_cmp_key_bool<keyval_t> cmpfunc;
00172     //ensure_sorted();
00173     return upper_bound(begin(),end(),keyval_t(key,val_t()),cmpfunc);
00174   }
00175   pair <iterator_t,iterator_t> equal_range(const key_t key) {
00176     //ensure_sorted();
00177     return make_pair<iterator_t,iterator_t>(vlower_bound(key),vupper_bound(key));
00178   }
00179   
00180   /// @brief       Dumps the contents of the map for debugging.
00181   void print() {
00182     printf("--------------------\n");
00183     for (size_t i=0;i<vec.size();i++) {
00184       printf(" %3d : %3d => %3d\n",int(i),int(vec[i].first),int(vec[i].second));
00185     }
00186   }
00187 };
00188 
00189 #endif // __VECTORMAP_H_
